content: Are there any client teams that are

author: parithosh
content: how many validators do you guys run per host?

author: matthewkeil
content: Perhaps <@1349892533454635109> or <@1349842134546649172> have some insight.  One of us can debug further and see what comes up.

author: mininny
content: Every other node in the devnet has 100 validators per host. But for some reason, i just realized that lodestar nodes have no validator attached. Should I put some validators on the node and see if the behavior changes?

author: matthewkeil
content: although that will not explain the behavior you are seeing above... there should def be a bandwidth difference with less columns being gossiped

author: parithosh
content:
oh interesting, with no validators the supernode should indeed use more bw than a full node :/

if you had a lot of validators connected then both would use the same (validator custody requirements)

author: mininny
content: yea they're both using the lower end of the bandwidth (with the odd numbered node being supernode)

author: mininny
content: I'll add the validators to the node

author: matthewkeil
content:
<@1351272205555863614> would you mind adding my keys to the Lodestar sunnyside boxes so i can SSH in to look through the logs?

https://github.com/testinprod-io/ethereum-devnets/blob/27c86616c5a1931e3537e33dd9086e658dfb8c5e/ansible/inventories/peerdas-devnet-ssl-15/group_vars/lodestar.yaml#L8

https://github.com/matthewkeil.keys

author: mininny
content: Added! can you check acces now?

author: derekg.base
content: re: specifically why the bandwidth is similar between full nodes and supernodes, I suspect it might be because lodestar subscribes to all column subnets regardless of column custody ([PR here](https://github.com/ChainSafe/lodestar/pull/7607), <@931591385545584640> if this makes sense). By "using the lower end of the bandwidth" do you mean they're averaging less bandwidth than other nodes?

author: matthewkeil
content: That's a really good point. I forgot that we didn't merge that yet

author: matthewkeil
content: Where you can definitely see a difference would be in db size

author: mininny
content:
Yea, the [bandwidth usage is closer to the other full nodes](http://94.130.19.237:3000/d/dsfasdfasf/network-monitor?orgId=1&from=now-15m&to=now&timezone=utc&var-network=peerdas-devnet-ssl-15&var-consensus=$__all&var-execution=$__all&refresh=1m&var-group_by=supernode,consensus_client&viewPanel=panel-29) in the network (nimbus-geth-1/lodestar-reth-1 is supernode, but lodestar uses less bandwidth)

The db size is also similar with lodestar-geth-1 and 2 using `16G` and `13G` respectively. 

I've added new validators to the deposit queue, so I'll monitor it over the weekend and see if the behavior changes in any way
